metadata.synopsis: The Head Banker is grateful to be saved and can reveal some details about what happened in the Counting House
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Head Banker after saving him from the cultists

0.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
0.text: I hope you've come to make a lodgement. A city-sized one.
0.context: NodeContext: Snort of pure derision - we just suggested he personally cover some of the bank's losses

118.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
118.text: You lost innocent people's money. The Guild ought to swallow some of that cost.
118.context: NodeContext: Snort of pure derision - we just suggested he personally cover some of the bank's losses

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You lost innocent people's money. The Guild ought to swallow some of that cost.
29.context: NodeContext: Snort of pure derision - we just suggested he personally cover some of the bank's losses

35.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
35.context: NodeContext: Snort of pure derision - we just suggested he personally cover some of the bank's losses

131.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
131.text: Oh. You're serious. Maybe you don't have a head for accounting, but that's... not quite how the numbers work.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: These large numbers, they wrinkle Minsc's brow and bring a soreness to his skull. Make them smaller, please.
75.context: NodeContext: Air of friendly threat. You're intimidating a corrupt banker to eat some of his own losses before you'll agree to retrieve his stolen coin.

110.speaker: Minsc
110.text: These large numbers, they wrinkle Minsc's brow and bring a soreness to his skull. Make them smaller, please.
110.context: NodeContext: Air of friendly threat. You're intimidating a corrupt banker to eat some of his own losses before you'll agree to retrieve his stolen coin.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'd listen to him. Before his hamster has to give him a head rub.
48.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'd listen to him. Before his hamster has to give him a head rub.
60.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Minsc has no use for such large numbers. As with my hamster, smaller would be better.
59.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

132.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
132.text: Hamster...? But - look, I can't. The losses -
132.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

62.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
62.text: Hamster...? But - look, I can't. The losses -
62.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

109.text: I... wish I could help you, Stone Lord. I really do. But it's just the economy, yeah?
109.context: NodeContext: Wary, doesn't want to get beaten over it, but it's just not in him to bring the number down. He can't even explain it so just gestures vaguely at 'the economy'.

100.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
100.text: I... wish I could help you, Stone Lord. I really do. But it's just the economy, yeah?
100.context: NodeContext: Wary, doesn't want to get beaten over it, but it's just not in him to bring the number down. He can't even explain it so just gestures vaguely at 'the economy'.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: You're not going to have much of a head for numbers if I crack it open.

64.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
64.text: I'm trying to hire you, and you're extorting me - with a dash of violence on top. Might be you have a future in the Guild.

102.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
102.text: I'm trying to hire you, and you're extorting me - with a dash of violence on top. Might be you have a future in the Guild.

40.text: Do it, then. Won't put bread on anyone's table, if that's what you actually care about.

19.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
19.text: Do it, then. Won't put bread on anyone's table, if that's what you actually care about.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: The heist on Manycoins bank in Neverwinter. Ring a bell?
28.context: NodeContext: Warily recalling an old story he heard that we're using to threaten him.

76.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
76.text: Aye. The Head Banker was beaten to death by a mob, on the rumour she'd taken a cut from the robbers. You... wouldn't stoop to spreading rumours now, would you...?
76.context: NodeContext: Warily recalling an old story he heard that we're using to threaten him.

107.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
107.text: Aye. The Head Banker was beaten to death by a mob, on the rumour she'd taken a cut from the robbers. You... wouldn't stoop to spreading rumours now, would you...?
107.context: NodeContext: Warily recalling an old story he heard that we're using to threaten him.

88.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
88.text: Fine. I'll pull in some debts with the other Guild kingpins - I can cover maybe half of what's lost.
88.context: NodeContext: Frustrated sigh as you relent - you're being extorted and you have no choice.

16.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
16.text: But I need something back, understand? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

81.text: But that's why I pay my guards so well - to keep me well looked-after.

39.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
39.text: But that's why I pay my guards so well - to keep me well looked-after.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: A lot of people will suffer. You can be the one who did that to them, or you can be the one who helped.
72.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to hear any more of our bleeding heart nonsense, relenting just to make us stop

70.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
70.text: Oh, enough. Should I wash the feet of every beggar down by the docks, too?
70.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to hear any more of our bleeding heart nonsense, relenting just to make us stop

45.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
45.text: Oh, enough. Should I wash the feet of every beggar down by the docks, too?
45.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to hear any more of our bleeding heart nonsense, relenting just to make us stop

134.text: Or you can be the one to return all that money, and get a nice, shiny reward in return.

104.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
104.text: Or you can be the one to return all that money, and get a nice, shiny reward in return.

86.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
86.text: So come back when you have it, aye?

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

84.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
84.text: Not my coin. That of every common mucker in Baldur's Gate.

85.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
85.text: Let's me and you make sure they don't all wake up as paupers tomorrow, hm?

111.speaker: Player
111.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

67.speaker: Player
67.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

113.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
113.text: Me too, I suppose, because I'm not even tempted to scam you. Take this vault key - you'll find something by way of thanks inside.

99.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
99.text: Me too, I suppose, because I'm not even tempted to scam you. Take this vault key - you'll find something by way of thanks inside.

96.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
96.text: This should be the part where I reward you... but looks like someone's nicked my key. Eh... consider this your one-time permission to crack the vault open. But if anyone asks, I never said it.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Here's the coin that was taken. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
8.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

103.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
103.text: And not even a whisker light. Gods, you're a boring bastard. A beautiful bastard! Sir.
103.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

135.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
135.text: And not even a whisker light. Gods, you're a boring bastard.

14.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
14.text: You can tell Nine-Fingers - this was not my fault. She swore that mimic could swallow a bloody owlbear.
14.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

54.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
54.text: Wait - you're no Guild-sworn. Who are you?
54.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What was that about your guards turning cultist?
11.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

22.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
22.text: Aye, my own sword-arms. Loyal to the Guild, but more importantly - loyal to me.
22.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

71.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
71.text: Never knew them to be god-botherers. But we've sent them to be with their precious Absolute now - good riddance.
71.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

127.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
127.text: Now, respectfully and all that bollocks - I asked who you are.
127.context: NodeContext: Getting us back on track, not that respectfully at all

116.speaker: Player
116.text: The person who just saved your life. A little gratitude wouldn't go amiss.
116.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

49.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
49.text: Gratitude of the gold variety, I suppose you mean? Good luck with that.

65.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
65.text: The Stone Lord just cleared our vaults - and now he has enough gold to make himself a lord in truth.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I came to stop you and save Minsc. Seems there was no need.
15.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

89.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
89.text: Friend to the mad Rashemaar, are you? He calls himself the Stone Lord now.
89.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

38.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
38.text: With what he cleared from our vaults, he's got enough gold to make himself a lord in truth.
38.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

55.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
55.text: And he wouldn't even know what to spend it on. It's the cult that needs that money - why?
55.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

58.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
58.text: And he wouldn't even know what to spend it on. It's the cult that needs that money - why?
58.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

108.speaker: Jaheira
108.text: And he wouldn't even know what to spend it on. It's the cult that needs that money - why?
108.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

98.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
98.text: You think anyone told me? Nine-Fingers sent word the Stone Lord was going to try his luck on our vaults. So she told me to cooperate - lure him in.
98.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

31.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
31.text: 'Yes sir, Stone Lord, sir. Shall we open the account in your name, or the Absolute's? Just step this way to your special deposit box - don't mind the teeth.'
31.context: NodeContext: Mock-polite and helpful tone, describing how he played along in an effort to trick the stone lord. 'Don't mind the teeth' is a reference the chest they tricked Minsc into - a mimic.

97.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
97.text: No one mentioned he might have some old crone dropping in as backup.
97.context: NodeContext: Back to annoyed and defensive voice

112.speaker: Jaheira
112.context: NodeContext: He accidentally referred to Jaheira as a crone and is backing off a little, doesn't want to piss her off

12.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
12.text: Eh, look, I just mean to say - we both want him caught. If you've got your sights set on the Stone Lord anyway...
12.context: NodeContext: He accidentally referred to Jaheira as a crone and is backing off a little, doesn't want to piss her off

130.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
130.text: As chairman of the Fellowship of Financiers, I can assure you we'd reward you well for the return of the coin he took.

57.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
57.text: Not for us, you understand. For the common Baldurian. Who knows what he's planning to do with it?

74.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
74.context: NodeContext: 'Not like we'd let him...' part is a snort of derision at the idea of letting anyone steal their wealthy customers gold.

129.speaker: Player
129.context: NodeContext: 'Not like we'd let him...' part is a snort of derision at the idea of letting anyone steal their wealthy customers gold.

23.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
23.text: Try all of it. Every penny of civilian lodgings, anyway. Not like we'd lead him into the private vaults. But, still - lot of Baldurians waking up poor tomorrow.
23.context: NodeContext: 'Not like we'd let him...' part is a snort of derision at the idea of letting anyone steal their wealthy customers gold.

61.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
61.text: What he can do with that kind of coin... doesn't bear thinking about.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Say I find the money. What's to stop me keeping it for myself?
52.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

63.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
63.text: Compassion for your fellow folk? Or maybe just good sense - that much money only paints a target on your back.
63.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

5.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
5.text: In our hands, it keeps this city ticking over. Stock in merchants' stalls, food in hungry bellies.
5.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

33.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
33.text: Retrieve the coin, and I'll make sure you are well rewarded. There's treasures greater than gold.
33.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

41.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
41.text: Feel free to poke around this place if it'll help you pick up the Stone Lord's scent. Me - I've got ledgers to amend.
41.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Maybe I'll just tell Nine-Fingers about your failure here instead.

30.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
30.text: Maybe you do. Gets me a beating, and gets you exactly nothing.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I just need to find Minsc. I care nothing for coin.

125.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
125.text: Good for you. I happen to care a very great deal.

121.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
121.text: What does the cult want with that much money?
121.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

2.speaker: Player
2.text: What does the cult want with that much money?
2.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I don't care about the coin. I just need to know where he went.
24.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

6.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
6.text: Funny, that. I don't give a damn about him, but I care very much where the coin went.

87.speaker: Player
87.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

106.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
106.text: You saw what he did to that mimic, aye? Would you take him head-on if you thought you could just play along instead?
106.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Security consultant. Your vaults leave a little to be desired.
82.context: NodeContext: Dry - not impressed by our boast of being a master thief

51.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
51.text: You're missing your motley, jester. We softened our defences to lure that bastard in. Nine-Fingers wants the Stone Lord dead.

18.speaker: Player
18.context: NodeContext: Dry - not impressed by our boast of being a master thief

120.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
120.text: Our cunning trap just got flipped arse-ways up, is what. Nine-Fingers wants the Stone Lord dead.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: A thief - one who could strip you of every copper if I so chose.
90.context: NodeContext: Dry - not impressed by our boast of being a master thief

21.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
21.text: You're a little late, master bandit.
21.context: NodeContext: Dry - not impressed by our boast of being a master thief

66.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
66.text: Those conniving little shits. My own guards, turned cultist? I pay better than any bloody Absolute.

105.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
105.text: And you - you're no Guild-sworn. Who are you?

68.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
68.text: Wait - you. What in Shar's shitting shadows have you come back for?
68.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock, fear masked by anger - player is using Minsc to speak to Rakath. Last time they met, Minsc almost killed Rakath.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You have been the subject of many wrinkled brows between my hamster and I, Saer Banker-Beard.
114.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

42.speaker: Player
42.text: On the one hand, you are clearly evil, and deserving of a mouthful of righteous knuckle.
42.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

79.speaker: Player
79.text: But on the other hand - the one in which Boo sits, and pleads your case - at the time of our last meeting, Minsc was the evil one.
79.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

119.speaker: Player
119.text: So. We are not agreed on whether we will return here and feed you to a mimic - yet.
119.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

13.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
13.text: I see. Well. By all means... keep me up to date. If you do come back - feel free to bring that coin you took...?
13.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

128.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
128.text: I see. Well. By all means... keep me up to date.

73.speaker: Minsc
73.text: You have been the subject of many wrinkled brows between my hamster and I, Saer Banker-Beard.

20.speaker: Minsc
20.text: On the one hand, you are clearly evil, and deserving of a mouthful of righteous knuckle.

27.speaker: Minsc
27.text: But on the other hand - the one in which Boo sits, and pleads your case - at the time of our last meeting, Minsc was the evil one.

32.speaker: Minsc
32.text: So. We are not agreed on whether we will return here and feed you to a mimic - yet.

101.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
101.text: Saer Stone Lord. Minsc. Any... progress on that gold?
101.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but hoping against hope Minsc has returned the gold

133.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
133.text: Now the guildmaster needn't skin me for a pair of boots. Though she still might like to.
